context_bundle.summary: Go generics with type parameters, constraints, and generic programming patterns for reusable type-safe code

common_patterns: Generic function: 'func Min[T constraints.Ordered](a, b T) T { if a < b { return a }; return b }'
Generic type: 'type Stack[T any] struct { items []T }; func (s *Stack[T]) Push(item T) { s.items = append(s.items, item) }'
Constraints: 'type Number interface { ~int | ~int64 | ~float64 }; func Sum[T Number](nums []T) T { var sum T; for _, n := range nums { sum += n }; return sum }'
Type inference: 'result := Min(1, 2) // T inferred as int'
Multiple type parameters: 'func Map[T, U any](slice []T, fn func(T) U) []U { result := make([]U, len(slice)); for i, v := range slice { result[i] = fn(v) }; return result }'
Comparable constraint: 'func Contains[T comparable](slice []T, item T) bool { for _, v := range slice { if v == item { return true } }; return false }'
Interface constraints: 'type Stringer interface { String() string }; func Print[T Stringer](items []T) { for _, item := range items { fmt.Println(item.String()) } }'
Approximation: 'type Integer interface { ~int | ~int8 | ~int16 | ~int32 | ~int64 }' for underlying types
known_errors: type parameter not used: Ensure type parameter used in function signature or body
constraint not satisfied: Check type implements required methods or matches union
cannot infer type: Provide explicit type parameter 'Function[int](args)'
invalid constraint: Ensure constraint is interface type with type elements
comparable not working: Use 'comparable' constraint for == and != operations
performance overhead: Generics have minimal overhead, profile if concerned
